intro: Epilobium obscurum f. crassicaule, commonly known as the broad-leaved willow herb, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are arranged opposite along the stems and are often covered with fine hairs. The species is noted for its ecological importance as a food source for various pollinators and wildlife.
